entry.title: IMPLEMENTACI√ìN SAC con SAP Business One 10 HANA
entry.content:
Estimados,

Nos encontramos evaluando los requisitos t√©cnicos para implementar SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) en conjunto con nuestro entorno de pruebas de SAP Business One versi√≥n HANA, el cual se encuentra en modalidad on-premise.

Sabemos que existen dos m√©todos posibles de conexi√≥n desde SAC hacia SAP HANA:

  1. Conexi√≥n directa (Live Connection)

  2. Conexi√≥n a trav√©s de SAP Cloud Connector

En este contexto, nos surgen algunas dudas que agradecer√≠amos puedan ayudarnos a aclarar:

  • ¬øAmbos tipos de conexi√≥n requieren licencias espec√≠ficas adicionales?

  • ¬øEs necesario instalar componentes adicionales en el servidor SAP HANA o en otro equipo?

  • En el caso de utilizar SAP Cloud Connector, ¬øqu√© tipo de servidor o especificaciones m√≠nimas se recomiendan para su instalaci√≥n? ¬øEs necesario que sea un servidor robusto?

Agradecer√≠amos cualquier documentaci√≥n, experiencia o recomendaciones que nos permitan avanzar de forma correcta con esta implementaci√≥n.

Desde ya, muchas gracias por su colaboraci√≥n.

Saludos cordiales,

entry.title: Resource Purchase & Consumption IFP Product Costing
entry.content:
Dear All,

Could anyone assist with how we should plan the purchases of raw material resources using the standard product cost content in IFP?

We aim to calculate:
Opening Stock + Purchases ‚Äì Consumption  = Inventory.

While consumption is easy to derive, determining the required purchases is unclear. Additionally, is there a way in IFP to display the breakdown of change‚Äîi.e., show purchases and consumption separately instead of a net change? If so, how can this be achieved? need to show the balances interms of Quantity 

Looking forward to your guidance.

entry.title: How to Compare versions by selecting manually
entry.content: "I have four public versions: two are Forecast and two are Budget. I want to use two separate input controls, one to display only the Forecast versions, and another to display only the Budget versions. The user should be able to manually select one Forecast version and one Budget version from the respective input controls to compare between one forecast and one budget in a table."

entry.title: End-user consumption of Datasphere data in SAC
entry.content:
Good afternoon,

We have SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud products.

I have the following question that I didn't find an answer to in the documentation. I'm new to Datasphere and SAC.

For a user to view the data from the analytical model in a story, do we also need to enter it into Datasphere?

These are end users who should only see a data dashboard.

Thank you in advance for your help.

SAP Datasphere SAP Analytics Cloud

entry.title: How to Use an Attribute from One Model to Populate a Dimension in Another Model via Data Action (SAC
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I‚Äôm working with two planning models in SAP Analytics Cloud: Model A (FIN_COSTPLANNING) contains the dimension CostCenter, which has an attribute called DepartmentGroup_Assignment. Model B (HR_RESOURCEPLANNING) includes both CostCenter and DepartmentGroup as separate dimensions.

My goal is to create a Data Action in Model B that uses the CostCenter as a link to bring in the corresponding DepartmentGroup (originally stored as an attribute in Model A) and write it into the DepartmentGroup dimension in Model B.

Since attributes cannot be directly referenced in advanced formulas, I‚Äôm unsure how to best implement this logic across models. 

What is the recommended solution to achieve this?

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Can SAC work like power pivot from Excel?
entry.content:
Gurus,

  I came across this very basic issue in SAC just trying things around: Table A has customer ID and sales, Table B has customer ID and customer region. I just wanted to make a graph of sales by region by linking dimension customer ID in the 2 tables. However after linking i could not make the graph because SAC gave me this error message: 'For the ewidget to render, you need to add a linked dimension between the primary model and the secondary model.'

  The whole point of linking dimension to me is to do power pivoting similar to that in Excel. If i have to add the linked dimension there is no point of making the graph. What am I missing here? Thank you!

entry.title: Performance improvements in SAC Story Building
entry.content:
üöÄ Speed vs. Features in SAP SAC?

Some features in SAP Analytics Cloud make stories "shine" ‚ú®‚Äîothers just slow them down üê¢.  I‚Äôve seen both, and it made me wonder‚Ä¶

In our SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) stories, we wanted to automatically set the date input to the previous month when the story opens. Since SAC doesn‚Äôt support customer exit variables like in traditional SAP BW reports, we solved it using a script in the onInitialization event.

This script runs as soon as the story opens and sets the input control to the previous month based on the current date.

Here's the script with step-by-step comments:

// Get the current date and time
var cur_date = new Date(Date.now());

// Extract the current year and month
var jahr = cur_date.getFullYear();  // e.g., 2025
var monat = cur_date.getMonth();    // January = 0, December = 11

// If the current month is January (0), go to December of the previous year
if (monat === 0) {
    monat = 12;
    jahr = jahr - 1;
}

// Create a CalendarDateTime object for the previous month
// Note: month must be 1-based (January = 1, not 0 as cur_date.getMonth() hands it over)
var calenderYearCCD = CurrentDateTime.createCalendarDateTime({
    granularity: CalendarTimeGranularity.Month,
    year: jahr,
    month: monat
});

// Set the application's current date/time filter to the calculated month
Application.setCurrentDateTime(calenderYearCCD);

Current Date Input Control for dynamic date range setting of all widgets:

 

üõ†Ô∏è What We Tested to Improve Performance

To support our dynamic date script and reduce load times, we experimented with several SAC story features to see how they affect performance:

  • üîÅ Widget Data Refresh Options ‚Äì e.g. refresh active widgets only

  • üëÅÔ∏è Initial Widget Visibility ‚Äì showing all widgets by sizing them accordingly

This script is used in onActive, the Panels are set to 1/10 the size they should be, so the user sees all widgets on the story when she opens the story. This had a huge impact on loading times. because otherwise as soon as she starts scrolling, the widgets that have not been loaded yet start loading which weirdly can take even more time then loading everything together.

var AllShrinkPanels = [Panel_64, Panel_78, Panel_67, Panel_79, Panel_80, Panel_81, Panel_82, Panel_83, Panel_84, Panel_85, Panel_86, Panel_87];


for (var w = 0;w<AllShrinkPanels.length;w++){
	AllShrinkPanels[w].getLayout().setWidth(AllShrinkPanels[w].getLayout().getWidth().numberValue * 10);

  • üîó Linked Dimensions ‚Äì Astonishingly this alone was not an issue

  • üß≠ Filters Across Linked Models ‚Äì As long as all filters are created based on the same model, there was no serious performance issue (but using dimensions from another model was.

  • ‚ûï Sums in Tables ‚Äì huge impact on loading times

  • üé® Conditional Formatting ‚Äì looks great, marginally hurts performance

  • üîÑ Linked Analysis Across Models ‚Äì convenient but can be a bottleneck, if key dimension is not included in other model so it has to join twice to get a result.

‚ö†Ô∏è Disclaimer: Our tests were done using fairly large datasets, so the performance impact may vary with smaller or simpler data models.

üí¨ What‚Äôs your take?

Which SAC features help or hurt performance in your experience? Let‚Äôs share tips and horror stories.üëá

entry.title: SAC Live Connection to CDS Entity
entry.content:
Has anyone tried using a CDS Entity as a source to a SAC story using a Live connection?

The earlier definition of 'define view' with '@Analytics: { query: true }' annotation works fine. I am able to browse and find the 2C<sqlViewName> in SAC.

But when I use the 'define view entity' with '@Analytics: { query: true }' annotation, I am able to see the 2C<CDSviewName> in RSRT, but it does not show up in SAC.

I couldn't find much information on CDS entity as a source to SAC. Has anyone tried using CDS entity in SAC?

entry.title: Set Custom Story as Default Landing Page in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I would like to know if it is possible to change the default landing page in SAP Analytics Cloud when a user logs in (as an end user).
Specifically, instead of opening the default "Today" page, I want the system to automatically open a specific Story page that I created.

Is this possible?
If so, how can it be configured?

Thank you!

 
Ask ChatGPT

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud Optimized Story Experience API Reference Guide
entry.content:
I have the following problem: I want to get a notification in my story both in the SAC and by mail when I click on a button (function onclick() ).

Here is my code:

 

var user_info = Application.getUserInfo();
console.log(user_info);
 
console.log("Senden beginnen:");
Application.sendNotification({
    "title": "Test",
    "content": "Test2",
    "receivers": [Application.getUserInfo().id],
    "isSendEmail": false
 
}
);
console.log("Senden beendet:");
 
I also have the appropriate authorizations (Runtime notification). Unfortunately, I still don't get a notification and the following exception is thrown in the JS code.

KR

Dominik

entry.title: Is there a standard query to get the conversion rates from BW ?
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

I am trying to import exchange rates from S/4HANA to SAC, but there is no standard CDS view available for this purpose. Therefore, I am attempting to import them from SAP BW. However, I cannot find a suitable query in SAP BW either. Could someone please let me know how to get exchange rates from SAP BW to SAC?

entry.title: Facing issues with shown data in SAC
entry.content:
Dear all

We have problems with newly created users that no data is displayed.

We use the SAC with a live data connection to a BW 7.5. Existing users can evaluate the stories in the SAC as usual.
New users can also open the stories, but no data is displayed.
The necessary roles and teams in the SAC are assigned.
When I execute the BW query via transaction rsudo for these users, results are also displayed.
So I suspect that the problem lies in the SAC.

Could this be related to the new RateRoles? Or are such problems generally known since QRC2/2025?

Thank you and best regards
Stefan

entry.title: SAC Data Point Comment - Keeping Comments when Changing Data Context
entry.content:
Hi Everyone, 

Is there any way to keep data point comments even if the data context is changed?

We have a table as below and we would like to link the comments to specific dimensions only (in this case Products, Plants, Countries).
So, the rest of the dimensions (Dimension A, Dimension B etc.) could be removed from the table or replaced with another dimensions. But the comments should be still visible as the specific dimensions are in the table.

ProductsPlantsCountriesDimension ADimension BSales QtyComment
Product A Plant ATurkeyCategory ASupplier A200Sales Qty is low due to high prices.
Product B Plant BGermanyCategory BSupplier B300 
Product C Plant CUSACategory CSupplier C400 

Therefore, the comments should only be related to key characteristics (e.g. product, plant, country) and not to the whole table structure.

Is there any way to achieve this workaround via SAC Scripting?

Thanks,
Onur

entry.title: SAC | Linked Variables | Filtering on chart with two BW live models not working properly
entry.content:
Dear all,

I‚Äôm currently working on a story in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) where I‚Äôve combined two models for use in a single chart. Both models are linked via the dimension ‚Äúcal/month‚Äù and a corresponding story variable.

The challenge I‚Äôm facing is that updates to the story variable are not consistently reflected in the chart that uses both models. While the variable change correctly impacts separate charts based on individual models, it fails to update the blended chart after the initial refresh. Interestingly, the first change to the variable after refreshing the story does work‚Äîbut subsequent changes only affect charts that are not using linked queries.

Data Source: SAP BW Live Connection

First Refresh:

 

Second Refresh:

 

Linking settings:

 

Chart Design

I‚Äôve seen a similar issue raised in the SAP Community, though no resolution was provided. This raises the question: is this a known limitation, or could it be a product bug?

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/linked-variables-as-story-filter-not-working-correctly/qaq-p/12179295

Best

entry.title: Comparison BO publication VS SAC publication
entry.content: Hi, In the SAC, I have created stories, e.g., story_1, and stories for the business need o/p file in the two formats. One is PDF, and the other format is Excel. Do we have similar functionality in the BO publication that allows one Webi template to schedule different formats to be sent to a business email box, a single publication?

entry.title: Data Action : Allocating cost per customer based on their Area.
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I need help in allocating cost per customer based on their Area based on same company code, plant and profitcenter.

I have two models:

  • Cost Model (Source):
    Dimensions: Company Code, GL Account, Cost Center, Plant, Profit Center
    Measure: Amount

  • Revenue Model (Driver):
    Dimensions: Company Code, Cost Center, Plant, Profit Center, Customer
    Measure: Area

I want to allocate the Amount from the Cost Model to customers using the Area from the Revenue Model as the driver. The allocation should be proportional based on Area.

The final output should assign each cost line item from the Cost Model (identified by Company Code, GL Account, Cost Center, Plant, and Profit Center) to one or more Customers, such that the total Amount is fully distributed across customers based on their share of the Area within the same dimensional intersection (Company Code, Cost Center, Plant, and Profit Center).

My input data : Cost Model

Revenue Model : 

After Allocation , I want each customer which is K1 to K4 should repeat for each GL account G1 and G2 and than , the Allocated cost should be calculated as

Allocation Logic

  • For each GL Account (e.g., G1 and G2), and for each Customer (K1 to K4):
    • Allocate cost proportionally based on Area.
    • Formula:

Allocated Cost= Amount√ó Area / Sum of Area‚Äã

 

Desired O/p: Final Output I am expecting

Can you please let me know how we can do it using Data Action in SAP Analytics cloud. 

 

@N1kh1l  : Can you please share your expert advice on this as well ?.
